name: Much, Much, More Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Many people fell in love with the little boy who played Tony in "The Little Vampire" and George from "Stuart Little".  And though some people think that perhaps that these movies were the end of his acting career, that is not the case.  Who is this actor?
questions.explanation:
Jonathan Lipnicki.

	Jonathan Lipnicki first began his acting career in 1996 with his role of Jeff Foxworthy's son on "The Jeff Foxworthy Show", and his first film was "Jerry Maguire".  He appeared in "Stuart Little" in 1999 and "The Little Vampire" in 2000.  He has also guest starred in TV shows such as "Touched by an Angel" (2003), "Family Guy" (2005), and "Glen Martin, DDS" (2009).

questions.text: Of course, everybody is familiar with Haley Joel Osment, the kid who made it big with "The Sixth Sense".  He had also starred in a few other movies at a very young age, but in his teenage years, it seemed that he had quit his acting career.  However, he had not left the entertainment scene.  He was hard at work for years, voicing the main character of a video game series.  In which series did he voice Sora?
questions.explanation:
Kingdom Hearts.

	In 1994, Haley Joel Osment starred in his first film, "Forrest Gump".  In 1999, he shone as Cole Sear on "The Sixth Sense", and in 2000, he starred in "Pay it Forward".  However, in the early 2000s, he didn't appear in many films.  However, his voice was still out there.  He voiced Mowgli on "The Jungle Book II" and voiced Sora from the "Kingdom Hearts" series, the first of which was "Kingdom Hearts" (2002).

questions.text: The girls on "The Cosby Show" were always well loved, and they're still loved today.  Vanessa Huxtable, later moved on to host "Clean House".  What actress portrayed Vanessa?
questions.explanation:
Tempestt Bledsoe.

	Tempestt Bledsoe played Vanessa Huxtable on "The Cosby Show" from 1984-1992.  She later went on to host "Clean House" in 2011, taking over for Niecy Nash.

questions.text: She first appeared on "The Cosby Show" in 1989 when she was only four years of age.  She later starred in "Dr. Dolittle", then had her own show, for which she even was the executive producer for season four.  She also is a very popular singer, and thus sang and acted in "The Cheetah Girls".  Who is it?
questions.explanation:
Raven-Symone.

	Raven Symone began her acting career as Olivia on "The Cosby Show" in 1989.  She went on to star in countless movies and television shows, and even became a successful singer/songwriter and even a dancer.  She starred in her own show, "That's So Raven" from 2003-2007, and voiced Monique on "Kim Possible" from 2002-2007.  She also voiced Iridessa from the "Tinker Bell" animated films.  In 2011, she starred in yet another series, "State of Georgia", which aired in 2011 with 12 episodes in the season, and was then cancelled later that year.

questions.text: "The Cosby Show" provided the start of quite a few young actresses.  This actress, who played adorable Rudy, went on to star in "Tyler Perry's House of Payne".  What actress played Rudy?
questions.explanation:
Keshia Knight Pulliam.

	Keshia Knight Pulliam starred as the much-loved youngest daughter of the Huxtables on "The Cosby Show" from 1984-1992.  In 2008, she starred as Calvin's wife on the hilarious sitcom "Tyler Perry's House of Payne".

questions.text: Sometimes its hard to imagine that Brenda Walsh from "Beverly Hills, 90210" was once just a sweet little Jennie Wilder on "Little House on the Prairie".  But since her role as Jennie she has gone on to do many incredible things.  Who is this actress?
questions.explanation:
Shannen Doherty.

	Shannen Doherty began her acting career in 1981, but it wasn't until 1982 when she first starred as Jennie Wilder that Doherty jump-started her acting career.  From 1986-1988 she starred as Kris Witherspoon in "Our House".  Perhaps one of her most widely recognized roles was from 1990-1994, when she played Brenda Walsh in "Beverly Hills, 90210".  She later revived the role in the 2008-2009 season of "90210".

questions.text: DJ was the oldest daughter on the 1987-1995 show "Full House".  The actress who played her did not stop with this show, however.  She went on to play Summer on "Make It or Break It".  Who is this actress?
questions.explanation:
Candace Cameron.

	Candace Cameron is perhaps the best known for playing D.J. Tanner on "Full House" from 1987-1995.  That was not all she did in her acting career, however.  In 2009-2011, she starred as Summer Van Horn on "Make It or Break It".

questions.text:
Scott Weinger is known for his role as Steve on "Full House", as well as for a Disney character's voice.  However his acting did not end in his teens.  He continued to act, but in later years, his career went off the screen as he became a writer and producer for many shows, including "90210".

Which Disney character did he voice?
questions.explanation:
Aladdin ('Aladdin').

	Scott Weinger voiced Aladdin in the 1992 Disney animated film "Aladdin", as well as "The Return of Jafar" (1994) and "Aladdin and the King of Thieves" (1996).  He also voiced Aladdin in the animated television series as well as for the "Kingdom Hearts" video game. He played Steve Hale from 1992 to 1995 on "Full House". In 2011, he began writing and producing the show "90210".

questions.text: "Full House" was not the only thing these twins starred in.  In 1993, at the age of seven, they established a company called DualStar.  They marketed their look; and to much success.  In fact, in 2007, they were 11th on Forbes' list of the richest women in entertainment.  They also had a television series as well as a series of books using them as characters.  Who are these twins?
questions.explanation:
Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen.

	Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen are fraternal twins who began their acting career as Michelle Tanner, the youngest daughter on "Full House" (1987-1995).  At only seven years of age, they created their own company called DualStar.  As teenagers and young women in their early 20s, acting was not the only thing Mary-Kate and Ashley were good at.  They also created a successful fashion line, and many successful teen products under the DualStar company. Though they were very busy with their fashion line and DualStar, that did not stop the Olsen's from acting.  They starred in their own television series, and they both starred in dozens of movies; either sharing the role, or playing twins in the movie.  They have also both had their own movies that did not star their twin sister.

questions.text: Who would have thought that the little boy from "Big Daddy" would grow into a famous Disney Channel actor? Furthermore, he was actually part of a set of twins.  Cole and Dylan Sprouse grew up to star as lead roles on which Disney Channel show?
questions.correct: The Suite Life of Zack and Cody/On Deck
questions.explanation:
The Suite Life of Zack and Cody/On Deck.

	Cole and Dylan Sprouse first starred in "Grace Under Fire" from 1993-1998.  They got their first film role as Julian on "Big Daddy" in 1999.  However, it was not until many years later that they finally got another role.  In 2005, they starred on their own Disney Channel show "The Suite Life of Zack and Cody".  In 2008, that show ended and it became "The Suite Life on Deck". They guest starred on "Hannah Montana" and "That's So Raven" episodes for the "That's So Suite Life of Hannah Montana" mash-up in 2006.  In 2009, they guest starred again on "Hannah Montana" and also on "Wizards of Waverly Place" for the crossover event "Wizards on Deck With Hannah Montana". "The Suite Life of Zack and Cody" was a Disney Channel show about two twins (Zack and Cody) who lived at the Tipton, a hotel in Boston.  The show was about their adventures (whether good or bad) at that hotel.  "The Suite Life on Deck" was a spin-off show that acted more as a sequel; the pilot episode was skipped and the show delved right in.  The first episode had Zack and Cody leaving the hotel to go on to the SS Tipton to attend school there and see the world.  The show is similar to the original "Suite Life of Zack and Cody", but their antics took place on a ship rather than a hotel.
